head.title: SvelteKit i18n Starter
head.description: This is a robust example of i18n internationalization with SvelteKit.

home.description: This is a robust example of i18n internationalization with SvelteKit. This example demonstrates various internationalization patterns and routing approaches.
home.warning: Work in progress: But I cover most of the cases. If you found some improvement, feel free to open PR üòä

pages.description: Here are various routing patterns for different page types

simple.title: Simple Page
simple.description: A basic static page demonstrating simple routing patterns

slug.title: Slug Page
slug.description: Dynamic page with modifiable URL slug parameter routing

query.title: Query Parameters
query.description: Interactive page that accepts and displays URL parameters

slugBetween.title: Slug Between Paths
slugBetween.description: Complex routing with dynamic slug between localized segments

external.title: External Path üîó
external.description: This link works outside [lang=lang] so it won't add language prefix and will always work consistently

head.title: Simple Page
head.description: This is a basic page nested within another folder

pageSimple.description: This is a basic page nested within another folder

head.title: Slug Page
head.description: Dynamic page where you can replace the last URL segment with your own

pageSlug.description: This is a slug page where you can replace the last URL segment with your own

head.title: Page with Query Paremeters
head.description: Interactive page demonstrating URL parameter handling and display

pageQuery.description: This is an interactive example page demonstrating URL parameter handling. The default parameters are '?x=1&y=2', but you can modify or add your own custom parameters to see how they're processed and displayed.

head.title: Page with Slug Between Paths
head.description: Dynamic routing with localized paths and slug parameters between them

pageSlugBetween.description: Here you can see how localization works with paths before and after a dynamic slug parameter, like 'URL/this-is-slug/URL'

head.title: Server API Endpoints
head.description: Demonstration of server-side API endpoint functionality

server.description: Here you can see how server-side API endpoints work in practice

simple.title: Simple
simple.description: Demonstrates how a basic GET API endpoint works

rest.title: REST
rest.description: Shows how to send multiple query parameters to endpoints

translated.title: Translated
translated.description: Example of returning localized content based on selected language
translated.translated: This is a translated string based on the current language

head.title: REST Pages
head.description: Demonstration of REST parameter pages and routing

rest.description: Here is an example of REST parameter pages

dynamic.title: Dynamic Path
dynamic.description: Dynamic routing based on URL depth and parameters

restBetween.title: REST Between Paths
restBetween.description: Complex routing with dynamic REST between localized segments

head.title: Dynamic Path
head.description: Example of dynamic path routing with 'dynamic/a/b/c' structure

restDynamic.description: Example of dynamic path routing with 'dynamic/a/b/c' structure. You can try adding your own segments to see how it works

head.title: Page with REST Between Paths
head.description: Dynamic routing with localized paths and REST parameters between them

restBetween.description: Here you can see how localization works with paths before and after a dynamic REST parameter, like 'URL/rest/a/b/c/URL'

head.title: Playground
head.description: Collection of interactive playgrounds to test various features

playground.description: Here is a collection of interactive playgrounds where you can test different features
playground.notTranslated: This page text is not translated, but the URL is localized

head.title: External Page
head.description: This page is located outside the [lang=lang] route and doesn't add a language prefix. This is useful for API endpoints, robots.txt, or other resources that should always be accessible regardless of localization.

external.description: This page is located outside the [lang=lang] route and doesn't add a language prefix. This is useful for creating API endpoints, robots.txt, or other resources that should always be accessible regardless of localization. Note that while the URL is outside the language routing, the content itself can still be localized.

errors.title: Page not found
